title: 1914–15 in Scottish football
text:
The 1914–15 season was the 42nd season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in Scotland and the 25th season of the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a>. The addition of <a href="Lochgelly%20United%20F.C.">Lochgelly United</a> and <a href="Clydebank%20F.C.%20%281914%29">Clydebank</a> meant that there were fourteen teams in Division Two.
Scottish League Division One.
Champions: Celtic
Scottish Cup.
There was no Scottish Cup competition played.
Other honours.
County.
. *replay
Junior Cup.
<a href="Parkhead%20F.C.">Parkhead</a> were winners of the Junior Cup after a 2–0 win over <a href="Port%20Glasgow%20Athletic%20Juniors%20F.C.">Port Glasgow Athletic Juniors</a>.
Scotland national team.
There were no Scotland matches played with the <a href="British%20Home%20Championship">British Home Championship</a> suspended due to <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>.
